meanings.definition: The act of putting someone in a prison for political reasons or during a war.
examples: Japanese-Americans were forced to leave their homes and were held in internment during World War II.

images.alt: Photo of children in internment camp.
images.description: Children standing in front of tar-paper covered buildings.
images.caption: Americans with Japanese ancestry were relocated to internment camps like this during World War II.

meanings.definition: A state of health or of being fit for use.
examples: Her teeth are in good condition from frequent brushing.

meanings.definition: An economic state in which business is very bad and many people are out of work and poor.
examples: With the city in a depression, it was almost impossible to find a job and many businesses were failing.

images.alt: Photo of people in a line outside for food.
images.description: Unemployed men lined up outside a depression soup kitchen opened in Chicago by Al Capone in 1931. The storefront sign reads "Free Soup, Coffee and Doughnuts for the Unemployed."
images.caption: People lined up for food during the economic depression of the 1930s.

source.title: Unemployed men queued outside a depression soup kitchen opened in Chicago by Al Capone. February 1931
source.author: The U.S. National Archives and Records Administration

meanings.definition: Of or involving the body.
examples: Bruises and broken bones are evidence of physical abuse.

images.description: A hand with a large bruise below the thumb.
images.caption: A bruise is physical evidence that someone has been hurt.

meanings.definition: To get or acquire.
examples: I contracted a cold from my friend.

meanings.definition: An unhappy or unlucky state or situation.
examples: After no electricity for a week, the plight of the people was dismal.

images.alt: Photo of a woman with her head down, face in hands.
images.description: A person with head down, her face in her hands.
images.caption: A person crying over her plight.

meanings.definition: An object or picture that represents something else.
examples: The American flag is a symbol of the United States.

images.description: The flag of the United States. The flag has red and white stripes, and a field of blue with white stars in the upper left corner.
images.caption: A flag is a symbol that represents a country.

meanings.definition: Someone who moves from place to place.
examples: At one time, some Native Americans were migrant people.

images.alt: Photo of people in a crop field.
images.description: Photo of a field with plants growing low to the ground. Six people are in the field. Some are sitting on wooden boxes. One seems to be reclining back.
images.caption: Migrant workers taking a break from havesting crops.

meanings.definition: To bring into being; to found.
examples: Of the 10 internment camps that were established, two of the larger ones were in Arizona.

meanings.definition: Ordinarily; usually.
examples: Dorothea Lange's most famous photograph is commonly known as the 'Migrant Mother.'

meanings.definition: To continue to live despite serious threat to one's life.
examples: The woman was a widow with seven children, who survived by eating frozen peas from the fields and birds her children caught.

images.alt: Photo of small plants in sand
images.description: Small plants growing in dry sand.
images.caption: Small plants surviving in harsh conditions.

source.title: Mini plants growing on smooth soil in sandbox
source.author: Jorge Sepúlveda

meanings.definition: A skill or talent in making things by hand or in the arts.
examples: Lange decided at 18 that she wanted to be a photographer and began learning the skill through classes and apprenticeships, in which she worked with other photographers to learn her craft.

images.description: A person's hands are touching the sides of a wet clay pot. The sides of the pot are soft and can be shaped. The person is holds a wet cloth along the rim of the clay pot to shape it.
images.caption: Pottery is the craft of making things out of clay.

meanings.definition: A condition or fact connected with or having an effect on an event or situation.
examples: Lange recalled the circumstances of taking the photo.

meanings.definition: To bring into being; to found.
examples: Of the 10 internment camps that were instituted, two of the larger ones were in Arizona.

meanings.definition: Ordinarily; usually.
examples: Dorothea Lange's most famous photograph is predominantly known as the 'Migrant Mother.'

meanings.definition: To continue to live despite serious threat to one's life.
examples: The woman was a widow with seven children, who subsisted by eating frozen peas from the fields and birds her children caught.

images.alt: Photo of small plants in sand
images.description: Small plants growing in dry sand.
images.caption: Small plants surviving in harsh conditions.

source.title: Mini plants growing on smooth soil in sandbox
source.author: Jorge Sepúlveda

meanings.definition: A job or career; occupation.
examples: Lange decided at 18 that she wanted to be a photographer and began learning the skill through classes and apprenticeships, in which she worked with other photographers to learn her vocation.

images.description: A person's hands are touching the sides of a wet clay pot. The sides of the pot are soft and can be shaped. The person is holds a wet cloth along the rim of the clay pot to shape it.
images.caption: Pottery is the vocation of making things out of clay.

meanings.definition: A condition or fact connected with or having an effect on an event or situation.
examples: Lange recalled the instances around taking the photo.

meanings.definition: A job or career; occupation.
examples: Lange decided at 18 that she wanted to be a photographer and began learning the skill through classes and apprenticeships, in which she worked with other photographers to learn her trade.

images.description: A person's hands are touching the sides of a wet clay pot. The sides of the pot are soft and can be shaped. The person is holds a wet cloth along the rim of the clay pot to shape it.
images.caption: Pottery is the trade of making things out of clay.

meanings.definition: A condition or fact connected with or having an effect on an event or situation.
examples: Lange recalled the events around taking the photo.
